column4: hi people, i'm trying to install a driver for my 5650 HD card on a 64bit 10.10 maverick system.. everything i'v tried so far has given nothing but errors
okay
better to ask in #ubuntu+1 , it's the maverick chat
no audio ?
: no audio AND no video
which graphics card and what are you connecting the hdmi to ?
: Radeon Mobility HD 5650. laptop is vaio, tv is bravia
I have to ask, is the tv set to the proper input ?

: yes, i'm 100 procent sure. I just tried HDMI port 1 and 3 and input 1 and 3, and all i get is a black screen. when i try to set it up in system>pref>monitor it thinks my tv is 72" (it's 32) and when i apply the settings(enable tv screen) i get an xorg error, t doesn't support the resolution size - no matter which resoultion i pick
and i can't configure through the gfx driver, because i don't have one (ati+ubuntu= -.-)
do you have the ati control center installed ?
: i can't install fglrx
ok which driver do you have ?
i dont even know. i'm guessing the one that comes with ubuntu 10.04. as far as im concerned it's impossible to install any ati driver for my gfx card on ubuntu(i've been trying for the past 72 hours)
according to this page there is new fglrx prerelease driver available that works , check it out ,https://bugs.launchpad.net/archlinux/+source/fglrx-installer/+bug/544638
: thanks, i'll try it, can i get back to you if it fails?
yes , but I dunno how I can help :(
can you give me a step-by-step instruction on how to install that driver (including the steps on the homepage), i'm frankly quite confused :S
homepage ?
you gave me a link https://bugs.launchpad.net/archlinux/+source/fglrx-installer/+bug/544638
every link i press that looks like a download just leads me to another redirect to something unrelated
long story short you said "there is new fglrx prerelease driver available that works" - how do i install it? :)
